SafetyInspectionBy: City of Vernon  Health & Env. Control Dep.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A RMP Executive Summary Component should include:



?The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source 

?The stationary source and regulated substances handled; 

?The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps; 

?The five-year accident history; 

?The emergency response program; and, 

?Planned changes to improve safety



The sections below summarize the Executive Summary.



Accidental Release Prevention Policies

Lineage Logistics - Sierra Pine, Vernon Facility has a long standing commitment to worker, public and environmental safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration system.  

Lineage Logistics - Sierra Pine, Vernon Facility's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substance.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled

Lineage Logistics - Sierra Pine, Vernon Facility is located at 3001 Sierra Pine Avenue in Vernon, California 90058, and is situated approximately 1 mile south of Interstate 5 and lies on the intersection of Sierra Pine Avenue and Bandini Boulevard. The immediate area surrounding the facility is primarily commercial and residential. 

The regulated substance handled at the facility is anhydrous ammonia. The facility's primary activities revolve around large-scale public storage of food products. All of the ammonia inventory is used as refrigerant.



Accidental Release Prevention Program

As part of the implementation of this CalARP Program, key Prevention Program elements were documented and implemented by Lineage Logistics - Sierra Pine, Vernon Facility to manage process safety issues associated with the use of anhydrous ammonia.  Furthermore, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe

practices are being performed.



The regulated substance is over the 500-lbs. state threshold for CalARP Program and the 10,000-lbs. federal threshold for EPA RMP and Cal-OSHA PSM.  As a result, the anhydrous ammonia covered process (ammonia refrigeration system) is subject to CalARP Program 3.



Program 3 Prevention Program Elements include:

?Process Safety Information

?Process Hazard Analysis

?Operating Procedures

?Training

?Mechanical Integrity

?Management Of Change

?Pre-Start Safety Review

?Compliance Audit

?Incident Investigation

?Employee Participation

?Hot Work Permit

?Contractors

?Trade Secrets



Five-Year Accident History

Lineage Logistics - Sierra Pine, Vernon Facility has had no releases in the last five years (December 2011 - December 2016) that meets the five-year accident history reporting criteria, therefore no data is required. 



Emergency Response Program

In addition, Lineage Logistics - Sierra Pine, Vernon Facility has an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) in place to properly prepare for emergency evacuations, to provide first aid and medical treatment and to contact federal, state and local officials in the event of a major release of ammonia. The Facility Emergency Response Plan is coordinated with the local responding units, such as the fire department or HAZMAT Team.  A current copy of the EAP and Crisis Management Plan, that includes ammonia responses, can be found with the Plant Manager or Facility Maintenance Manager.

In addition, the Facility has submitted a Hazardous Material Inventory (HMI) Business Plan via California Environmental Reporting System (CERS).  HMI was submitted and accepted on November 11, 2016.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Several studies have been conducted to examine mitigation measures to improve safety at the facility.  These studies include:



?A Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) revalidation was performed in October 26, 2016.

?A Hazard Assessment, performed in December 2016.

?Seismic Assessmen

t was performed on December 2016.



Any outstanding recommendations from these studies and the target completion date or closure have been provided within each individual report.
